creator: coz@luukku.com
text:
I have notices that apache2 doesn't generate http_referer for logs and scripts
if I'm using Mozilla, IE or Lynx. If I telnet to http-port and manually enter
the refererer, it works OK.

I have checked with Ethereal that Moz and IE use the referer and it is correct
and sent to server, but Apache just ignores it. Maybe those other fields that
browsers  send confuse Apache? The referer isn't shown in logs (empty referer
there) or in any php script I try. Other environment variables (that I've tried)
work just fine.

I'm using Apache 2.0.4 and PHP 4.3.0
Added a test URL. Clicking the button should update HTTP_REFERER.
creator: coz@luukku.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
er, works for me (Phoenix 0.5 and Lynx tested on your URL). Do you have some
proxy or anonymizer software running?

Hmm. I did some testing from a few computers outside the corporation and they
all seemed to work OK. Maybe someone has installed a filter that drops the referer.

So it seems this is not apache's bug. Sorry :)
